DataElement.preferredName: Immune Cell Function Assay Assay Type ImmuneCellFunctionAssayType
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A set of laboratory assays that examine the responses of lymphoid or myeloid cells after exposure to an experimental material._The determination of the amount of a particular constituent of a mixture or of the biological or pharmacological potency of a drug.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities._The list of values for immune cell function assay types

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Immune Cell Function Assay Assay Type
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A set of laboratory assays that examine the responses of lymphoid or myeloid cells after exposure to an experimental material._The determination of the amount of a particular constituent of a mixture or of the biological or pharmacological potency of a drug.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A set of laboratory assays that examine the responses of lymphoid or myeloid cells after exposure to an experimental material.

Concepts.definition: A set of laboratory assays that examine the responses of lymphoid or myeloid cells after exposure to an experimental material.

Property.preferredDefinition: The determination of the amount of a particular constituent of a mixture or of the biological or pharmacological potency of a drug.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A qualitative or quantitative analysis performed to determine the amount of a particular constituent in a sample or the biological or pharmacological properties of a drug.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 9/21/11 Released caNanoLab v1.5 content per Sue Pan as part of model cleanup task.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The list of values for immune cell function assay types

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A functional (qualitative) as well as quantitative assay that is utilized as an indicator of granulopoiesis reconstitution.

Concepts.definition: A functional (qualitative) as well as quantitative assay that is utilized as an indicator of granulopoiesis reconstitution.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The characteristic directional movement or orientation of an organism or cell along a chemical concentration gradient either toward or away from the chemical stimulus.

Concepts.definition: The characteristic directional movement or orientation of an organism or cell along a chemical concentration gradient either toward or away from the chemical stimulus.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A class of soluble glycoproteins which act nonenzymatically through specific receptors to regulate immune responses. Cytokines are derived from both immune and non-immune cells and are intercellular mediators that differ from hormones in that they are produced by a number of tissue or cell types rather than by specialized glands.:The act of bringing about something.

Concepts.definition: A class of soluble glycoproteins which act nonenzymatically through specific receptors to regulate immune responses. Cytokines are derived from both immune and non-immune cells and are intercellular mediators that differ from hormones in that they are produced by a number of tissue or cell types rather than by specialized glands.
The act of bringing about something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The adverse effect of some iatrogenic therapies. It is an accepted side effect in radiation therapy where the desired effect is to kill rapidly growing tumor cells.  In the killing of tumor cells, other cells that are rapidly growing e.g hair, mucous membranes are also killed.:Natural killer cells are cells that resemble large granular lymphocytes.  They do not express markers of either T or B cell lineage. They are positive for CD16, CD56, and CD 94.  These cells do possess Fc receptors for IgG and can kill target cells using antibody-dependent cell-mediated cytotoxicity. They can also use perforin to kill cells in the absence of antibody and killing may occur without previous sensitization.

Concepts.definition: The adverse effect of some iatrogenic therapies. It is an accepted side effect in radiation therapy where the desired effect is to kill rapidly growing tumor cells.  In the killing of tumor cells, other cells that are rapidly growing e.g hair, mucous membranes are also killed.

Natural killer cells are cells that resemble large granular lymphocytes.  They do not express markers of either T or B cell lineage. They are positive for CD16, CD56, and CD 94.  These cells do possess Fc receptors for IgG and can kill target cells using antibody-dependent cell-mediated cytotoxicity. They can also use perforin to kill cells in the absence of antibody and killing may occur without previous sensitization.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Blood cells that are devoid of hemoglobin, capable of ameboid motion and phagocytosis, and act as the principal components of the immune system.:Growth and reproduction of new similar forms, e.g. cells, buds, or offspring.

Concepts.definition: Blood cells that are devoid of hemoglobin, capable of ameboid motion and phagocytosis, and act as the principal components of the immune system.
Proliferation; a rapid increase in number.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A process that consists of the rapid release of reactive oxygen species. The process frequently ocurrs in cells when superoxide radical and hydrogen peroxide species are released.

Concepts.definition: A process that consists of the rapid release of reactive oxygen species. The process frequently ocurrs in cells when superoxide radical and hydrogen peroxide species are released.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Phagocytosis; the process by which phagocytes engulf and digest microorganisms and cellular debris; an important defense against infection.

Concepts.definition: The process by which phagocytes engulf and digest microorganisms and cellular debris; an important defense against infection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
